title: Franklin KY Man Arrested With Destructive Devices, Allegedly Planned to Blow Up School
content:
Updated: 
								
								
								
								 


Stream WZTV Fox 17 Newscasts LIVE  starting with Fox 17 This Morning at 4:30am, News at 5:30pm and News at 9pm & 10 pm. 
 
Simpson County, KY-- Franklin police have arrested 18-year-old Trey Alexander Gwathney Law for possession of a destructive device or booby trap device. According to one witness, Law allegedly intended to blow up Franklin Middle School. 
 
Per the police citation, Law had explosive devices in his shed behind his home on the 400 block of N. Railroad Street. A witness called police with the tip after Law allegedly told him of his plans to blow up the school. 
 
Police found 4 Molotov Cocktails and another glass bottle containing liquid that was sealed inside with a cork and melted wax over the cork with a fuse coming out the top. The devices were inside an old stove found in the shed. 
 
A court date for Law has been set for October 1st at 12pm.
